title: Council Regulation (EEC) No 1228/89 of 3 May 1989 fixing the target prices and intervention prices for colza, rape and sunflower seed for the 1989/90 marketing year
header:
COUNCIL REGULATION (EEC) No 1228/89 of 3 May 1989 fixing the target prices and intervention prices for colza, rape and sunflower seed for the 1989/90 marketing year
THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
For the 1989/90 marketing year, the target prices and the intervention prices for colza, rape and sunflower seeds shall be as follows:
(a)  target price for colza and rape seed:
- ECU 41,45 per 100 kg for Spain,
- ECU 45,02 per 100 kg for the other Member States;
(b)  intervention price for colza and rape seed:
- ECU 37,19 per 100 kg for Spain,
- ECU 40,76 per 100 kg for the other Member States;
(c)  target price for sunflower seed:
- ECU 48,00 per 100 kg for Spain,
- ECU 58,35 per 100 kg for the other Member States;
(d)  intervention price for sunflower seed:
- ECU 43,12 per 100 kg for Spain,
- ECU 53,47 per 100 kg for the other Member States.

For the 1989/90 marketing year, the supplement to be applied to the target price, to the intervention price and to the intervention buying-in price for Â´double zero' colza and rape seed shall be ECU 2,50 per 100 kg.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the third day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
It shall apply:
- from 1 July 1989 as regards colza and rape seed,
- from 1 August 1989 as regards sunflower seed.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 3 May 1989.
For the Council
The President
P. SOLBES
(1) OJ No 172, 30. 9. 1966, p. 3025/66.
(2) See page 15 of this Official Journal.
(3) OJ No C 82, 3. 4. 1989, p. 25.
(4) OJ No C 120, 16. 5. 1989.
(5) Opinion delivered on 31 March 1989 (not yet published in the Official Journal).
